definitions: To bring or come together again in order to renew an effort or to recover from a setback.
To organize or inspire a group of people to support a cause or to take action.
To recover strength, health, or spirits after a decline or setback.
To cause to come together for a common purpose.
examples: The team rallies in the final quarter.
The community rallies behind the new proposal.
His health rallies after the treatment.
